hero.subtitle: Affordable, high-quality Traditional Chinese Medicine care with flexible payment options

introduction.text: We believe healing should be accessible. Our pricing is straightforward with no hidden fees. We offer package discounts to make ongoing care more affordable, and we work with most insurance plans.
introduction.note: Invest in your health today - the cost of prevention is far less than the cost of illness.

insurance.title: Insurance & Payment
acceptedInsurance: Most major insurance plans with acupuncture benefits

insuranceInfo.title: Insurance Coverage
insuranceInfo.description: Many insurance plans now cover acupuncture for certain conditions. Coverage varies by plan, so we recommend calling your insurance company to verify your benefits before your first visit.
whatToAsk: How many visits are covered per year?
What is my copay or coinsurance?
Do I need a referral from my primary care doctor?
weProvide: Direct billing to insurance (for in-network plans)

hsa.title: HSA/FSA Eligible
hsa.description: All our treatments are eligible for payment using Health Savings Accounts (HSA) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA). We provide detailed receipts for your records.

cancellation.title: Cancellation Policy
cancellation.policy: We understand that schedules change. Please provide at least 24 hours notice if you need to cancel or reschedule your appointment. Late cancellations (less than 24 hours) or no-shows will be charged 50% of the treatment fee. Exceptions made for emergencies.

packages.title: Package Policy
packages.policy: Treatment packages must be used within the specified timeframe. Packages are non-refundable but can be transferred to immediate family members. If you need to pause your package due to extended illness or travel, please speak with us.

lateArrival.title: Late Arrival
lateArrival.policy: Please arrive 5-10 minutes before your scheduled appointment. If you arrive more than 15 minutes late, we may need to shorten your treatment or reschedule, and the full fee will apply.

newPatients.title: New Patient Forms
newPatients.policy: Please complete new patient forms before your first visit (available on our website) or arrive 15 minutes early to fill them out.

items.question: How many treatments will I need?
items.answer: This varies by condition. Acute issues may improve in 3-6 sessions, while chronic conditions typically require 10-15 treatments or more. We'll create a personalized treatment plan during your initial consultation and adjust based on your progress.

items.question: Can I use my insurance?
items.answer: We accept most major insurance plans that include acupuncture coverage. We'll verify your benefits and handle billing. Even if we're out-of-network, we can provide detailed superbills for reimbursement.

items.question: Are packages required?
items.answer: No, packages are optional. You can pay per visit if you prefer. However, packages offer significant savings and are recommended for chronic conditions that require multiple treatments.

items.question: What if I don't use all my package sessions?
items.answer: Packages must be used within the specified timeframe, but we're flexible if you have a valid reason for delay (illness, travel, etc.). Unused sessions can be transferred to immediate family members.

items.question: Do you offer payment plans?
items.answer: For patients without insurance, we can discuss payment plan options on a case-by-case basis. Please speak with us about your situation.

items.question: How much do herbs cost?
items.answer: Herbal formulas typically cost $20-$60 for a 1-2 week supply, depending on the herbs used. Raw herbs are less expensive than pills or powders. The consultation fee is separate from the herb cost.

items.question: Is there a senior or student discount?
items.answer: We offer sliding scale community acupuncture on Wednesdays ($35-$55) which is accessible to all. For regular appointments, insurance coverage or package discounts are the best way to reduce costs.
